restlib.server

Class ResourceWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • restlib.server.ResourceWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BioResourceDecorator, BioResourceWrapper, ConnegResourceDecorator

    public class ResourceWrapper
extends Object
implements Resource
    A Resource which forwards all its method calls to another Resource. Subclasses should override one or more methods to modify the behavior of the backing Resource as desired per the decorator pattern.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptMessage

        public ListenableFuture<Response> acceptMessage(Request request,
                                       Object message)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Handle the client request and message entity and return a response. This method is called by a connector when a client HTTP request includes a message entity and handle() provides an HTTP 100 Continue response.
        Specified by:
        acceptMessage in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        request - The client HTTP request.
        message - The client HTTP message body.
        Returns:
        The server's response to the client request.

      • handle

        public ListenableFuture<Response> handle(Request request)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Handle the incoming request and return a response. Note: HTTP methods that require the entity body of the request, should return a response with the 100 Continue status. Connectors will process this response and call acceptMessage when the message is available.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        request - The client HTTP request.
        Returns:
        The server's response to the client request.

      • route

        public Route route()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Returns the Route that this Resource matches.
        Specified by:
        route in interface Resource
        Returns:
        This Resource's Route.
